column2: So the wedding caterer sent me this list of twelve appetizers and I have\nto narrow it down to six.'
Food? Uh-huh gimme! (She hands him the paper.)'
So did Monica tell you about this great band called the Swing Kings\nthat we\xc2\x92re trying to get to play at the wedding?'
Since when are you into swing music?'
Oh since forever! I used to go all over town listening to bands!'
Chandler.'
Gap commercial. (To Monica) So did you book them? Did you call?'
I will.'
Do you want me to call?'
No, I\xc2\x92ll do it. You just stick to your job.'
What is your job?'
Staying out of the way.'
This is impossible Monica, why don\xc2\x92t you just pick all 15? (Hands\nback the paper.)'
There were only twelve.'
Oh yeah, I added three.'
What are peanut butter fingers?!'
Oh yeah\xc2\x85 (He mimes sticking his fingers into a jar of peanut butter,\nscooping some out, and eating it off his fingers.)'
(noticing a beautiful woman moving in down the street) Well hello!\nShe\xc2\x92s cute! Should we uh, go try to talk to her?'
Sure! That\xc2\x92s one of the great things about being engaged.\nI\xc2\x92m not nervous talking to pretty girls anymore.'
Uh yeah! Let me, let me get that for you.'
(exhales) I got it. (He lifts the box and grunts under the strain.)\n(Calmly) So hi, I\xc2\x92m uh, I\xc2\x92m Ross and this is my friend Chandler. (He shyly\nwaves.)'
Kristen, hi. Are you uh, new to the area, \xc2\x91cause if you\nare\xc2\x85I\xc2\x92d love to show you around sometime.'
I\xc2\x85I uh, actually just moved from four blocks over.'
Ah.'
But-but this block is like a whole other world.'

Y\xc2\x92know actually it does have a very interesting history. Uh, this
street is the first street in the city to have an underground sewer system. (Kristen
crinkles her nose at that.) Before that sewage and waste would just flow right down the
street. Yeah, sometimes ankle deep! (He stops when he realizes what he\xc2\x92s talking
about.)'
(To Ross) Smooth.'
(To Chandler) Excuse me? (Chandler does the shy thing again.)'
Umm, say you\xc2\x92re gonna be starving after all this moving. What do you\nsay I take you to dinner tonight?'
Oh I\xc2\x92d like that.'
Yeah?'
Yeah.'
Great! Uh, let me take this up for you. (The box he\xc2\x92s holding.)'
After you.'
Oh no-no, after you. (She grabs a chair and heads upstairs.) (When\nshe\xc2\x92s gone.) Oh my God! (He drops the box and Chandler can\xc2\x92t pick it up.)'
(wearing a veil) Am I crazy or does this totally go?!'
Oh my God! You look so beautiful!'
(To Rachel) Thank you Rachel but, look at Monica!'
This is it. Yeah, this is the one. I can\xc2\x92t believe I found it!'
Well I\xc2\x92m Monica Geller, ball like a baby.'
Have you found your dress yet?'
Oh no, these dresses are all so amazing but there is no way I could\nafford one.'

No, I can\xc2\x92t afford this either. No. I-I-I\xc2\x92m, I\xc2\x92m just to\nfigure out which one I want then I\xc2\x92m gonna get it at Kleinman\xc2\x92s, this discount\nplace in Brooklyn, day after tomorrow they are having a huge sale.'
Oh, thanks for the tip.'
Yeah! So-so when are you getting married?'
Oh I\xc2\x92m not, I just like to try these on.'
I do the same thing.'
I\xc2\x92m just kidding. I\xc2\x92m getting married July 25th.'
I\xc2\x92m just kidding too. (Laughs) I\xc2\x92m getting married in\nDecember. (Turns away not happy with herself.)'
(To Monica) So when are you getting married?'
Oh May 15th.'
Oooh it\xc2\x92s getting close!'
Yeah!'
So uh, who\xc2\x92s your photographer?'
Jeffery.'
We met with him. Did he show you the photos of the nude wedding he did?'
The best man? Wow!'
I know! I almost called off my wedding. Oh, who\xc2\x92s your band?!'
Oh, my fiancee wants the Swing Kings.'
Oh, you\xc2\x92re so lucky. My fiancee wants the heavy metal band Carcass. '
Ooh, is that spelled with a \xc2\x91C\xc2\x92 or a \xc2\x91K\xc2\x92? Oh my God!\nIt doesn\xc2\x92t matter; they\xc2\x92re both great!'
Oh y\xc2\x92know what? Y\xc2\x92know what? Now that you know what you want\nyou should go to Kleinman\xc2\x92s and get it half off. This place is so overpriced.'
So, does this (The dress) come in another color or\xc2\x85 (The store\nowner walks away.)'
(checking her out) Hi! You uh, movin\xc2\x92 in or movin\xc2\x92 out?'
I\xc2\x92m moving in.'
Oh uh, can I give you a hand?'
Oh okay. But y\xc2\x92know what? Be careful. Because a guy was helping me\nbefore had to leave because he hurt his back.'
Boyfriend?'
No.'
I\xc2\x92m Joey. (They shake hands.)'
Kristen.'
Oh wow, what a beautiful name! (Pause) What is it again?'
Kristen.'
Got it! (He picks up a lamp.) So\xc2\x85'
So uh, do you live around here?'
Yeah! Yeah! Right down there. (Points.) Hey listen; let me give you a\nlittle tip. Do not take a nap on this stoop (Points to hers) or you can wake up with your\nshoes gone.'
I\xc2\x92ll remember that.'
Okay. Yeah. Listen would you uh, would you like to have dinner with me\ntonight?'
Oh I, I have plans tonight. '
Oh.'
But how about tomorrow?'
Sounds great! Okay all right, well where does this go? (The lamp he\xc2\x92s\nholding.)'
You look strong, why don\xc2\x92t I take that and you grab one of the\nboxes.'
Okay. Yeah. (She leaves and he goes to pick up a box marked books, but\ndecides to take the box marked pillows instead.) Yeah, I\xc2\x92ll grab this one. (He\nfollows her upstairs.)'
(To Phoebe) So this is Brooklyn.'

All right, listen up. There is usually only one dress in each size so
when they open those doors, fan out. Now, this is what you\xc2\x92re looking for! (Holds up
a picture of it.) Memorize it! When you locate the dress, blow on these. All right? (She
passes out whistles to them.) Three short blasts, when you hear it. Come running.'
Okay.'
Got it.'
All right.'
Oh they\xc2\x92re pushing! They\xc2\x92re pushing!!'
(To Rachel) Hey! Don\xc2\x92t be a baby!'
Well I\xc2\x85'
(coming back out) Hey! Rachel! Come on!!!!'

No. No. Not it. Not it. Not it. (Checks another rack and another woman
tries to reach around her.) (To the woman) Don\xc2\x92t crowd me! (Finds it) This is it!
This is the dress! Oh my God, it\xc2\x92s perfect! (She takes it off of the rack and someone
has a hold of it on the other side of the rack and tugs on it.) I\xc2\x92m sorry, this
one\xc2\x92s taken! (The other woman tugs harder pulling Monica through the rack.) Whoa!'
Megan!'
Monica!'
You came?!'
Yeah!'
This is my dress!'
No!'
Yes it is! You saw me wearing it!'
And now you\xc2\x92ll see me buying it.'
What? You freak! You wouldn\xc2\x92t even have known about this place if\nit wasn\xc2\x92t for me!'
Look, you don\xc2\x92t want to fight me.'
Maybe I do! I\xc2\x92m pretty feisty! (She blows the signal.)'
(hearing the signal) I\xc2\x92m coming! I\xc2\x92m coming! (She takes off\ntowards the signal and almost knocks another woman over.)'

Okay! (Runs that way and hears another whistle blast.) Hey! (Heads the
other way and hears another blast.) What do I do?!! (She runs in the second direction and
finds that the whistling is coming from inside a rack. She moves the dresses out of the
way to find Rachel curled up in a fetal position frantically blowing on the whistle.) What
are you doing? (Rachel doesn\xc2\x92t stop.) Did you find the dress? (Rachel won\xc2\x92t stop
so Phoebe pinches her nose shut which causes her to spit the whistle out.)'
Did you find the dress?'
No! You gotta get me out of here Phoebe! These bargain shoppers are\ncrazy!'
I\xc2\x97We gotta get Monica. (She starts to leave.)'
No! You gotta hold my hand!!'
Oh my God!! (She grabs Rachel\xc2\x92s hand and drags her towards Monica.)\nExcuse me! Excuse me! (She\xc2\x92s knocking women and veils out of the way as she moves.) '
(handing Phoebe the dress) Go! Go! Go!'
(seeing who\xc2\x92s trapped) Hey\xc2\x85'
NOW!!!!!!!! (Rachel runs off and Monica gets up to follow her.)'
So Ross, how was your date the other night? Did you tell her about the\nmagical ride that starts with the flush of every toilet?'
Laugh all you want but uh, she actually left me a message saying\nshe\xc2\x92d like to go out again.'
Huh.'
Yeah in fact, I\xc2\x92m gonna go call her right now. And I\xc2\x92ll make\nsure to tell her my friend Chandler says\xc2\x85 (He mimics the shy reaction Chandler did.)'
(entering) Hey Chandler!'
Hey!'
Listen, sorry I didn\xc2\x92t stop by last night but I had a date.'
Uh Joe, when it\xc2\x92s one o\xc2\x92clock in the morning and you\ndon\xc2\x92t come by? That\xc2\x92s okay!'
Well check it out, I was with this really hot girl who just moved in right\nacross the street!'
Really? Right across the street?'
Yeah!'
When\xc2\x92d you meet her?'
Two days ago.'
Excellent! Y\xc2\x92know Ross met somebody too!'
Oh yeah?'
(returning) Hey.'
Hi! How\xc2\x92d it go?'
Oh great! We\xc2\x92re going out again Saturday. But I just found she\xc2\x92s\nalso seeing some other guy.'
(sarcastically shocked) Really?! Joe? What would you do if you were in\nRoss\xc2\x92s situation?'
Well, I sorta am. I mean yeah, I\xc2\x92m dating this girl who\xc2\x92s also\nseeing another guy. But, I don\xc2\x92t know, I\xc2\x92m not to worried about it.'
Well you shouldn\xc2\x92t be. Believe me I wouldn\xc2\x92t want to be the guy\nwho\xc2\x92s up against you. (Chandler laughs.) I mean that doofus is going to lose!'

So this is nice! I wish I didn\xc2\x92t have to go, believe me! But\nunfortunately I have to. (He gets up and Joey moves over next to Ross.) Oh uh, by the way,\nwhat\xc2\x92s the name the girl you\xc2\x92re dating?'
Kristen Lang.'
Bye! (Exits.)'
Well obviously only one of us can keep dating her.'
Obviously! So, how do we decide?'
Well now let\xc2\x92s-let\xc2\x92s look at this objectively, I think I should\ndate her\xc2\x85'
(not buying it) Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Or, or I\xc2\x92m the one who dates\nher.'
That\xc2\x92s interesting, but check this out. I date her\xc2\x85'
Yeah-yeah I like that but just to go in another direction\xc2\x85'
Okay, okay. This can go on for a while.'
Yeah well we should order some food then.'
No Joey! Look why don\xc2\x92t, why don\xc2\x92t we just let her decide? Okay?\nHey-hey, we\xc2\x92ll each go out with her one more time. And-and we\xc2\x92ll see who\nshe likes best.'
(smiling) That sounds fair.'
Maybe I\xc2\x92ll take her to that new French restaurant down the\nstreet\xc2\x85'
Ah yeah\xc2\x97wait a second now! Look we\xc2\x92re gonna have to set a\nspending limit on the date. I don\xc2\x92t have the money to take her to a fancy place like\nthat.'
Well sorry, that\xc2\x92s what I do on dates.'
All right, well I guess I\xc2\x92ll just have to do what I do on dates.'
So let\xc2\x92s decide on the spending limit\xc2\x85'
Yeah. Uh, (thinks)\xc2\x85a slice\xc2\x85(Thinks)\xc2\x85six dollars?'
I was thinking more like a hundred.'
Okay. Can I borrow 94 dollars?'
Oh\xc2\x85'
I know. Hand me a tissue. (Monica hands her one.)'
You\xc2\x92re out of Diet Coke.'
Hello? (Listens) What?! (Listens) You what?! (Listens) Hey you listen\nhere missy! (Listens) Wh\xc2\x97(She is hung up on.)'
What?!'
That was that girl Megan! She booked the Swing Kings on the day of our\nwedding and said that I couldn\xc2\x92t have them back unless I gave her the dress!'
(gasps) Does that mean Carcass is available?'
What am I gonna do?! That is the dress! That is the dress!\nWh\xc2\x85Chandler wants the band. What do I do?'
Well just figure out a way to talk him out of it.'
How?'
You\xc2\x92re out of toilet paper!'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey! What\xc2\x92s up?'
I just wanted to come by and y\xc2\x92know, wish you good luck on your date.'
Oh thanks!'
Yeah. What time are you meeting her?'
We have 8
Wow, that\xc2\x92s in like 20 minutes. You\xc2\x92d better get dressed.'
I am dressed.'
Oh. Well good! (To himself) For me. (He picks up a jar of lotion.) What is\nthis? Did you give yourself a facial?'
I have an oily T-zone!'
Okay dude! (Finds a receit.) Hey you uh, you sent Kristen flowers.'
That\xc2\x92s right.'
You spent a hundred dollars. That\xc2\x92s the limit. You\xc2\x92re screwed!'
Uh actually, I sent the flowers before the actual date. So techincally, technically\nI didn\xc2\x92t break any rules. Thanks for stopping by though.'
Oh-oh! So that\xc2\x92s the way it\xc2\x92s gonna be huh? Yeah I can break the\nrules too y\xc2\x92know!'
Oh yeah? What are you gonna do?'
I don\xc2\x92t know.'
Why am I not surprised?'
Y\xc2\x92know what Ross? I\xc2\x92m not gonna let you get away with this!'
I don\xc2\x92t think you have much choice.'
Well we\xc2\x92ll see!'
Bye-bye!'
Yeah bye-bye! (Exits and comes back in still holding the lotion.) Hey! So\njust a light layer?'
Yes. Yes. Just here (Runs his fingers down the bridge of his nose) and\nthere (Runs his fingers across his forehead).'
Joey got meat sauce on the banister again! (He goes into the bathroom\nto wash his hands.)'
Yeah, swing music is so out.'
Phoebe, he\xc2\x92s gotta be in the room for that to work.'
(returning) What are you guys talking about?'
Well umm, we were just talking about the y\xc2\x92know, the Swing Kings\nand just wondering whether y\xc2\x92know, they were the right way to go.'

Yeah, I went to a wedding once where they had swing music and uh, two\nmonths later the couple got divorced. And now I\xc2\x92m not saying that there\xc2\x92s any\nconnection here y\xc2\x92know, but they did tell me that\xc2\x92s why they got divorced.'
But I love swing music!'
Yeah but the Swing Kings? Y\xc2\x92know they suck so much that people\nactually die at their concerts\xc2\x97They just stop living.'
Look all I know is when Monica and I went to see them, we had fun! And\nthere\xc2\x92s another reason too.'
Well, what is the other reason?'
I don\xc2\x92t want to say.'
Well you have to because maybe it\xc2\x92s stupid.'
Well it\xc2\x92s just while Monica and I were dancing to them it\nwas\xc2\x85the first time I knew that\xc2\x85you were the woman I wanted to dance all my\ndances with.'
Oh crap!'
So they said our table will be ready in just a few minutes.'
Oh great!'
Yeah.'
Is your back feeling better?'
Oh yeah it\xc2\x92s fine. I guess the more muscles you have the more they\ncan spasim out of control.'
(entering) Kristen?'
Joey!'
Hi!'
Hi! What are you doing here?'
Oh I like this place. And technically, technically I\xc2\x92m not breaking\nany rules so I\xc2\x85'
Well uh, Ross? This is Joey. Joey? Ross.'
Hi!'
Hi. (They shake hands.) It\xc2\x92s nice to meet you. I used to have a\nfriend named Joey. I don\xc2\x92t anymore.'
Our table will be ready in a couple minutes.'
Yeah. So\xc2\x85'
Sure! I would love to wait with you guys! Thanks! (Sits down.)'
So Joey umm, you look familiar. Are uh, are you on TV or something?'
Well Joey doesn\xc2\x92t like to talk about it but, he\xc2\x92s one of the\nstars of Days Of Our Lives.'
That\xc2\x92s right! That\xc2\x92s right, don\xc2\x92t you play a woman?'
A woman in a man\xc2\x92s body.'
Much better.'
So y\xc2\x92know Ross it\xc2\x92s funny \xc2\x91cause, you look familiar to me\ntoo. Have you ever been married?'
Well yes, yes I have. In fact umm, just the other day Kristen and I were\ntalking about how I\xc2\x92ve been married and how I have a son.'
Yeah, little Eric.'
That\xc2\x92s right! Wait no, Ben.'
So you\xc2\x92ve just married the one time then?'
Well umm\xc2\x85'
You\xc2\x92ve been married twice?'
Yes. And another time after that. Boy I\xc2\x92m getting hungry! Hey Joey,\nhave you ever been so hungry on a date that when a girl goes to the bathroom you eat some\nof her food?'
You said the waiter ate my crab cake.'
(laughs that one off) Yeah. So uh Ross, well now\xc2\x97why did that first\nmarriage breakup? Was it because the woman was straight or she was a lesbian?'
Do you two know each other?'
No. No.'
No. It just seems like Ross is the kind of a guy that would marry a woman\non the verge of being a lesbian and then push her over the edge.'
Wait a minute! Were you on a poster for gonorrhea?'
Have you ever slept in the same bed as a monkey?!'
Hey you leave Marcel out of this!'
Fine! Have you ever got stuck in a pair of your own leather pants?!'
Hey-hey have you ever locked yourself in a TV cabinet VD boy?!'
Monkey lover!'
When do you think we lost her?'
Probably around gonorrhea.'
Hi, honey! I\xc2\x92m home!'
(from the bedroom) Don\xc2\x92t come in here!'
Why? Do you another boyfriend in there or something?'
No! We only mess around at his place!'
Y\xc2\x92know it\xc2\x92s funny I started it but, now it\xc2\x92s scary me.\nSo could you come out here please?'
No, I\xc2\x92m wearing a wedding dress.'
Oh you got a wedding dress? That\xc2\x92s great!'
Yeah but I\xc2\x92m not keeping it.'
Well then why can\xc2\x92t I see it?'
Oh. I guess you can. Okay but; I-I have to return it, so you can\xc2\x92t\nlike it.'
Okay I promise. I\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll hate it. (She enters.) Wow!\nYou-you look\xc2\x85hideous.'
Really?'
Yeah, that\xc2\x92s like the most ugliest dress I\xc2\x92ve ever seen.\nWh-why do you to return it?'
Oh because it doesn\xc2\x92t\xc2\x85really fit. Oh by the way, I-I booked\nthe Swing Kings.'
Oh that\xc2\x92s great! Great! Thanks! But that dress I mean it\xc2\x92s\nlike yuck! It\xc2\x92s terrible! It makes me wanna just rip it right off of you!'
Okay! But you can\xc2\x92t rip it. Well, maybe a little.'
Okay!'
(entering) Hey guys! Do you wanna look at the song list for the wedding?\n(They ignore her.) Guys?'
(without turning around) I thought you were gonna be gone all day.'
All right? What\xc2\x92s going on?'
I\xc2\x92m sorry. I\xc2\x92m sorry. I-I should probably leave you girls\nalone. (She heads for the bedroom.)'
Yeah, laugh all you want but in ten minutes we\xc2\x92re gonna have younger\nlooking skin!'

Yeah! (Monica goes in the bedroom.) Y\xc2\x92know, she could use a\nlittle\xc2\x85(Whistles that she needs to do what they\xc2\x92re doing.) (Something happens on\nthe game.) Oh nice shot!!! (They all cheer.)'
